channel.title: Developing in Mopar
channel.description:
I'm advanced w/ java etc... Now my question is... I see all these narb questions asking 'how to make f cape drop less' how to cycle between male and female.. etc... blah blah blah...
Now to me these are stupid questions as I've done crap like this w/ API before and plenty of times.
Now what I need to know is where is the code that gives me the packages of mopar? Just like java... http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/ - It has the packages, and then it has util, etc. in it. Where is this for mopar?

item.title: Developing in Mopar
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

you are not experienced with java, that is called javadocs, if you want to javadoc a server learn how to use javadoc.exe, if you want to javadoc the client decompile it, and then learn how to use javadoc.exe

Read full topic

item.title: Developing in Mopar
item.dc:creator: @playermanny2 playermanny2
item.description:
@playermanny2 wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:13, topic:162162”]Ok my god i’m getting tired of your damn useless posts.

Heres a server:

http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,220316.0.html

Download it. Once you have downloaded it, extract, and motherfucking search client.java. Or is that too hard for you? When you open it, you will see the imports, which i have told you about 1000 billion times. And if you wish to study them, in the URL you gave us, they give you examples of it, so why the hell would you want to study it here, when its already there?[/quote]seriously if you want to learn moparscape try looking at a few tutorials and seeing how we program, and you can at least start by Downloading A Basic Source

Read full topic

item.title: Developing in Mopar
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

hes talking about the client… and sorry to say mopar doesnt have APIs…

mopar doesnt bother to make APIs for his client due to the fact he doesnt make it open sourced and i suppose you could learn from a open sourced client

Read full topic

item.title: Developing in Mopar
item.dc:creator: @Tri Tri
item.description:
@Tri wrote:

Simple question… Once again… Is there an API to moparscape? I don’t need idoits who DONT even know what it stands for posting… NOR do I need dumb fucks saying that it is so and so… BECAUSE it’s NOT! It’s usually HTML and still have yet to see it in the mopar directory… So is there one or not?

Read full topic

item.title: Developing in Mopar
item.dc:creator: @bug bug
item.description:
@bug wrote:

then gfto, no1 wants u here anyway

Read full topic

item.title: Developing in Mopar
item.dc:creator: @Tri Tri
item.description:
@Tri wrote:

omfg… javac has nothing do w/ API[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 02, 2007, 12:10:15 PM[/size][hr]You do not fucking compile API – omfg… this site sucks… API is packages that contain classes that contain useful code… FOR EXAMPLE - THERE SHOULD BE API TO MOPAR - IF THERE ISNT I’M WASTING MY TIME W/ shoddy ass moparscape - All you fuckers on this site are most likely little 12 year olds who want to emulate RuneScape. You see all these stupid questions can be answered with API. If you call this command for example…

import javax.swing.*;

That is a package -

You then can view the docs of the PACKAGE and then it’ll supply a line of info that’ll tell you what packages can be extended, etc. It is very useful and if you don’t have it, it’s a waste of time to even bother w/ ‘moparscape’.

I’m surprised if there is no API any ‘real’ java programmers stuck around here. Apparently not it seems…

Read full topic

item.title: Developing in Mopar
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

Tri:

dragonchain - I could careless about programming in mopar… I wish to study the API of mopar. Which if anyone had known or taken an actual course of java would know what I am talking about. WHEN I ask for API… OR EVEN DOCS…

It’s what we like to call a compiler.

Read full topic

item.title: Developing in Mopar
item.dc:creator: @Tri Tri
item.description:
@Tri wrote:

dragonchain - I could careless about programming in mopar… I wish to study the API of mopar. Which if anyone had known or taken an actual course of java would know what I am talking about. WHEN I ask for API… OR EVEN DOCS… Yes I may have came here sep 1st as you say but you think that I learned java after that? I’ve been programming in java about 4 years. It’s not my fault there are no tuts that would tell me where the API is (if it is even accessible)… Point made?

Read full topic

item.title: Developing in Mopar
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

Ok, first of all you think your all good because you searched on google what java means… and your saying people are asking stupid questions… your the one thats stupid, and your saying on a few topics “Learn Java” when it doesn’t have anything to do with java… if you want to be a java expert you do that… just don’t post on other topics that say “Learn Java” because it has nothing to do with java and I know how to code… I code servers and clients, which is not java so don’t tell me to learn java, I don’t mak GUI’s or anything, and don’t think your good yet… you signed up September 1st with only 14 posts…

Read full topic
